alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:51PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Jackson and south central Franklin Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 650 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Stevenson, or 15 miles west of Bridgeport, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Stevenson, Hollywood, Skyline, Anderson, Hytop, Bass, Martintown, Jericho, Estillfork, and Fackler. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
